titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 29: Bullae Sanctorum Pontificum

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Register of papal bulls, letters, etc. particularly from the period when the papacy was at Avignon. Contains 42 bulls, interdicts, etc. from John XXII (1316-1334), all pertaining to his struggle with Emperor Louis of Bavaria (f. 1r-123r). There is a table of contents for these bulls and a letter from Gregory IX (1227-1241), dated 29 January 1240 (f. 1r). Also contains papal letters dating 1352-1378 (f. 125r-276v); 112 letters from Innocent VI (1352-1362), mostly dealing with affairs of England, France and Sicily (f. 125r-176v); 165 letters from Gregory XI (1370-1378), 23 of which are in French and are mostly to the king of France, Charles V (f. 179v-262v); and miscellaneous papal letters, mostly of Urban V (1362-1370) (f. 263r-276v).
msContents.textLang: Latin, with 23 letters from Gregory XI in French

msItem.title: Bulls, interdicts, etc. of John XXII, f. 7r

supportDesc.extent: 276 leaves : 287 x 221 mm. bound to 295 x 225 mm

collation.p: Paper, ii + 276 + v; [ii], 1¹⁶, 2-10¹², 11-17¹⁶, 18¹⁴, 19¹², 20¹⁶, [v]; 1-124, 193-314; contemporary (probably original) foliation in brown ink, upper right recto; (loss of 68 folios from f. 124 to f. 193 due to a later rebinding); 1-276; near contemporary foliation in red ink, upper right recto. Folio references in this record use the second set of continuous foliation. Catchwords written in lower margin of versos, in a decorative border. Paper guards inside and outside of each quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script.

binding.p: 17th- or 18th-century French mottled calf over pasteboards, with gilded arms of the Lamoignon family. The leather is worn away at the hinges. Front cover board is almost completely detached. Leather is crumbly in places. Spine is deteriorating and separating from the binding in places.

origin.p: Written in France (Avignon?) in the late 14th to early 15th century.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by the Lamoignon family (stamp, upper and lower covers).
